                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>

                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>An interview with Black Hawk ; Black Hawk and the treaty of 1832 / [William J. Petersen and Billy Rienow]. 1933.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Two copies with differing titles of one of the programs in the series Iowa history radio programs, presented on April 4, 1933 by radio station WSUI at Iowa City. The series was presented by staff of the State Historical Society of Iowa to commemorate the one hundredth anniversary of the settlement of Iowa. This program presents an imaginary dialogue between Black Hawk and a young American boy at Fort Madison, Iowa. Black Hawk's replies to the boy's queries are taken from Black Hawk's autobiography. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Iowa Sate Historical Society</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>

resource.abstract: Two copies with differing titles of one of the programs in the series Iowa history radio programs, presented on April 4, 1933 by radio station WSUI at Iowa City. The series was presented by staff of the State Historical Society of Iowa to commemorate the one hundredth anniversary of the settlement of Iowa. This program presents an imaginary dialogue between Black Hawk and a young American boy at Fort Madison, Iowa. Black Hawk's replies to the boy's queries are taken from Black Hawk's autobiography.

                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Pioneers in person / [Ruth A. Gallaher and Marie Haefner]. 1933.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>One of the programs in the series Iowa history radio programs, presented on April 21, 1933 by radio station WSUI at Iowa City. The series was presented by staff of the State Historical Society of Iowa to commemorate the one hundredth anniversary of the settlement of Iowa. This program uses a dialog between two staff members to relate details of the adventures of some of Iowa's notable pioneers. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Iowa Sate Historical Society</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Pioneers in person / [Ruth A. Gallaher and Marie Haefner]. 1933.
resource.abstract: One of the programs in the series Iowa history radio programs, presented on April 21, 1933 by radio station WSUI at Iowa City. The series was presented by staff of the State Historical Society of Iowa to commemorate the one hundredth anniversary of the settlement of Iowa. This program uses a dialog between two staff members to relate details of the adventures of some of Iowa's notable pioneers.

                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>The people v. Patrick O'Connor / [Ruth A. Gallaher, Jacob A. Swisher and William J. Peterson].</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Two copies of a radio script for the second in a series of 5 radio programs broadcast over WSUI and presented by the State Historical Society of Iowa in 1934 to celebrate the ninth Iowa History Week. The program discusses the trial and execution of Patrick O'Connor at the Dubuque lead mines. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Iowa Sate Historical Society</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: The people v. Patrick O'Connor / [Ruth A. Gallaher, Jacob A. Swisher and William J. Peterson].
resource.abstract: Two copies of a radio script for the second in a series of 5 radio programs broadcast over WSUI and presented by the State Historical Society of Iowa in 1934 to celebrate the ninth Iowa History Week. The program discusses the trial and execution of Patrick O'Connor at the Dubuque lead mines.
